data.title: Map of Polish Composers
data.meta_description: That form-creating idea led Kazimierz Serocki to invent a peculiar ‘polyphony of colors of variable density, tempo and dynamics’, which he obtained via such procedures as, among others, usage of atypical ensembles and ingenious expansion of performance techniques (especially among wind and percussion instruments). The combination of those with his own individual expressive touch – balancing between vitality and energy on the one hand, and subtlety and lyricism on the other – meant that the composer became a leading representative of the avant-garde in new Polish music.
